document_data.caption: A map showing Waukeshire in Bloodstone Valley.
document_data.name: Waukeshire
document_data.mainbody: The '''Waukeshire''' was a small forest found in [[Bloodstone Barony]]. Situated within this forest was a [[halfling]] village of the same name.
document_data.Geography: The Waukeshire was located in [[Bloodstone Pass]] due east of [[Bloodstone Village]] and off to the northern side of the main road connecting the [[Vaasan Gate|Vaasan]] and [[Damaran Gate|Damaran]] Gates.
document_data.Description:
The trees of the Waukeshire stood straight and the undergrowth was kept trimmed, giving the forest a tidy appearance.

The tunnel complexes of the [[Warren]] were found beneath the forest, crossing under the [[Beaumaris River]] and connecting to the [[Warrenwood]].
document_data.History: During the occupation of Bloodstone Pass by allies of [[Zhengyi the Witch-King]] during the 1350s [[DR]], life continued much the same among the [[halfling]]s of Waukeshire, at least outwardly. in order to squirrel away their harvest and keep it safe from Zhengyi's bandits.
document_data.Inhabitants: The forest was home to most of the halfling population of [[Bloodstone Valley]]. Visitors and travelers were welcomed so long as they took care to avoid harming the foliage or littering, In the mid-to-late 14{{th}} century [[DR]], these halflings were governed by Mayor [[William (halfling)|William]] and their militia was led by the young [[Fredegast]].
